en.title: The Prompt Arena
en.text:
A fun and challenging competition to test your AI prompt engineering skills across three exciting rounds.

Format:
  • Round 1: Guess the Prompt – Generate an image matching a given one.
  • Round 2: Prompt Crossword – Solve AI-generated crossword clues.
  • Round 3: Prompt the chatbot to reveal its password.
Rules:
  • Individual registration (Max team size: 2)
  • Timed rounds (Total duration: 35 mins)
  • Highest total score wins
  • Judges' decisions are final

en.title: FIX THE **GLITCH**
en.text:
A competitive debugging event where participants must fix buggy code and ensure all test cases pass.

Format:
  • Round 1: Debug multiple problems; participants with the highest score advance.
  • Final Round: Solve problems quickly and efficiently; the fastest optimized solution wins.
Rules:
  • Individual event (No teams)
  • Participants must have an active HackerRank profile
  • Plagiarism or external help leads to disqualification
  • In case of a tie, execution time and code efficiency will be considered
Duration:
  • Round 1: 30 mins
  • Round 2: 45 mins
  • Total: 1 hr 30 mins

en.title: Code Relay
en.text:
A thrilling team-based coding event that tests coordination, problem-solving, and coding efficiency.

Format:
  • Teams of 3 participants.
  • Round 1 (Easy - 30 min): Each participant codes for 10 minutes on a simpler problem.
  • Round 2 (Advanced - 45 min): 15 minutes discussion, then 10 minutes per participant for a complex problem.
Rules:
  • Participants rotate coding in a set order.
  • No editing of previous work once a turn is over.
  • Only one participant codes at a time; another observes silently, and the third faces away.
  • Code must be functional, efficient, and well-documented.
  • No external resources (Google, ChatGPT, etc.).
  • Only one programming language is allowed (e.g., Python, C++, Java).
  • Participants can communicate only through code comments.
  • Hardcoded solutions are not allowed; the code must be scalable and dynamic.
  • Failure to comply with rules results in disqualification.

en.title: Pixel Perfect
en.text:
A team-based UI/UX design competition that tests creativity, problem-solving, and design skills.

Format:
  • Teams of 2 participants.
  • Round 1 (30 min): Live quiz; top-scoring teams advance to the final round.
  • Final Round (60 min): Design based on a given theme or real-world UI/UX problem.
Rules:
  • Plagiarism or external help leads to disqualification.
  • Teams must register before the deadline.
  • Only Figma is allowed; Canva is not permitted.
  • Submissions must include wireframes & prototypes (low/high fidelity) in PDF or Figma link format.
Judging Criteria:
  • User Experience & Usability (30%)
  • Visual Design & Creativity (25%)
  • Problem-Solving & Innovation (25%)
  • Presentation (20%)
Estimated Duration:
  • Round 1: 30 minutes
  • Round 2: 60 minutes
  • Total Duration: 1 hour 30 minutes
